body:
A lot of meatheads out there brag about knowing some fighting style and being tough guys, like these in MMA, boxing, etc.

In the real world, it is not worth the effort and waste of time and money training and getting beaten up like this, it is only useful for sports and to show off in front of others.

Look at the policemen or the soldiers in army, although they have some tough training with body contact, obviously, none of them are great fighters, so this shows that war professionals like them don't even waste time on something as ineffective as body contact, and they have been like this since ancient times, because everyone knows that body fighting is for animals, so even big strong men used weapons, be it a club, arrow, knife, sword, machine gun, etc.

The possibility of high and immediate damage makes you think about what you're going to do, and this have a meaning and a purpose, unlike these sport fights which are more like brainless dogs tearing each other apart for stupid motives like money. And this fighting culture also diverts young people from really useful things, like mechanics, agriculture and other things.

And still about this, I have a friend, although he is a few centimeters smaller than me, he is extremely stronger than me, he looks like a neanderthal, in a certain time, he trained so much and lifting weights he had his chest and arms bulging with pure muscle, so, as he could not grow more, and also be equal to other guys at the gym, then he talked to the trainer who explained that to get big like them, it was necessary to take something (steroids), but he did not take, he also knew how to fight boxing, and besides being stronger than me, he is faster than me too. One day, me, him and another friend, were in a car, I was sitting in the back, in front of me was that strong friend in the front seat, and the other one was driving, so I went and put my two hands on the strong guy neck and pulled hard, just for fun, my friend lost all his power and was weaker than a child, the most he could do was put his hands lightly over mine but he had no strength to remove my hands, I think he was losing consciousness, and this was in just less than three or four seconds, and I confess that I'm a weak guy too.

And also this MMA fight video of the idiot and fake ass Dave Bautista, he seems tough too, pure illusion, I remember that at the time of the fight, besides being a shame and cringe for him, there was still talk of it not being valid, since he punched his opponent in the back of the head... Bautista is an idiot who can't even fight, look at his hand movement, he looked scared from the beginning and during the fight.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0zk9B9hFKjA

To me this is proof that these guys who think that are tough guys, they're actually not even worth anything, even if they know how to fight and could kill you with their bare hands. Fighting is garbage and should be banned, it's degeneration stuff for brainless idiots and retards.

title: Fighting skills are stupid.

body:
The problem with all that training is in a civilised society it's useless. It's good for survival, but most people never get into a fight in their life. People who get into a lot of fights eventually end up in jail. 

I agree it doesn't seem worth all the effort past learning the basics. At least not unless you are making money at it. Think of all the BJJ guys that blew out their knees for a plastic medallion. Masochism. Alas, I would rather know it and not need it than vice versa.

body: Honestly I think you believe this because your mind is thinking about things like medieval armed combat with swords and shields or something like kung fu movies. Sure firearms have made that kind of combat practically moot, but definitely not unheard of. Combat training can help with direct physical conflict. What you described doing to your friend is the equivalent of an assassination, a sneak attack. If you happen to be in the military or law enforcement then that training would definitely be useful because you might be involved in close contact with people who's goal is to hurt you. Its not a matter of being a "great fighter" its a matter of being able to control the situation quickly. Nobody wants prolonged hand to hand combat because even the best trained fighters, if they had to fight for their lives, would tire quickly, and if you tire first your likely the first to die. By knowing how a situation feels and training your body to react accordingly, before thought, you have an edge. Some guy grabs your rifle and tries to fight you for control? Or maybe someone pins you against the wall while you were trying to arrest them. Sure for your average Joe learning "fighting skills" might not be practical beyond physical fitness, but even physical fitness is practical. In the end knowing how to fight is one of those things that you may not knew you needed until you find you need it, and by then its often too late.

post.title: Fighting skills are stupid.

body:
The goal of violence in terms of self-defense or offense isn't always the death of the opponent, and most people don't carry guns or knives on them all the time. Sometimes, even when you're carrying a weapon, you can be disarmed. And in countries where possession of firearms and other forms of weaponry are banned, and depending on where you live (crime rate and whatnot), fighting can be a good skill to learn.

Also, a simple search shows that "most armed forces do teach some form of unarmed combat, often a type of mixed martial arts where military personnel learn a combination of techniques including Taekwondo, Muay Thai, Krav Maga, grappling, and basic self defense against weapons in hand to hand combat."
